alert.note: Alert for Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:24PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by the earlier excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Tolland and Windham and Massachusetts, including the following counties, Hampden and Worcester. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of urban areas, smaller rivers, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 117 PM EST, Although Doppler Radar indicated that the steady and heavy rain exited the region earlier today. However...runoff and the earlier snowmelt will continue to result in flooding of small rivers and streams. - Do not drive through flooded roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Worcester, Shrewsbury, Mansfield, Windham, Plainfield, Westborough, Grafton, Willimantic, Killingly, Holden, Webster, Southbridge, Auburn, Northbridge, Oxford, Clinton, Millbury, Charlton, Coventry and Spencer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
